title: WUPHF.com
description: Some co-workers who invested in Ryan's Internet venture want him to sell, but Michael refuses to go along. Meanwhile, Jim loses his motivation to work when he reaches his commission cap, and Dwight creates a hay festival in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lights and power go off] Uh-Oh. Okay, okay, nobody panic. Listen Up, listen up. [Turns On Flashlight and holds it to his face] Everyone, follow me to the shelter. We've got enough food for 14 days. After that, we have a difficult conversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as the power and lights come back on] My Bad. Space Heater and Fan were both on high, plugged into the same outlet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, it's saying the server went down? Does Anybody know that password? 'Cause otherwise we can't do any work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... try "password".

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Try zero, Zero, Zero, Zero, zero, zero.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, now try Zero, Zero, Zero, Zero, zero, one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'm not doing every number.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, um, does anyone remember when it was set up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... it was like eight years ago?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Lord of the Ring stuff? I don't know, I'm just trying to think of things that were happening at the time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Um, everyone was getting their driver's license.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why don't we just call the I.T. Guy who set it up? What's the name of the guy in Glasses, again?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, moving backwards, our I.T. Guys have been...  Glasses, Turban, Ear Hair, Fatty 3, Shorts, Fatty 2, Lozenge, and Fatso. I think Lozenge was the one who installed it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I got it, try, um-[Coughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? It made me laugh when I heard it, but Pam got really offended.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Big Boobs.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Drama Queen?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nosy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're typing "Big Boobs"?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm trying everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Try "Big Boobs" with a "Z".

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's- [ding] the password. We're in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All Right

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The important thing is... this kept us secure people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How's It Going?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, I'm WUPHF.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [wearing Ryan's glasses] I'm Facebook.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What's up Facebook?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I sent you a Facebook message yesterday, I still haven't heard anything back.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You should've sent me a WUPHF.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A what?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [pulls out Blackberry] When you send a WUPHF, it goes to your home phone, Email, Facebook, Twitter and homescreen. All at the same time. [phone rings, computer chimes, printer starts up]

quotes.speaker: Robotic Voice
quotes.text: WUPHF.

quotes.speaker: {ryan} and {michael}
quotes.text: WUPHF!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dot com!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [getting copies from the color copier behind the receptionist desk] Thanks Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't wanna be a lousy snitch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ryan has been using the color printer for his business a lot, and as Office Administrator-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, it's okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But it's not for-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let it go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I invested in WUPHF. It's actually a great idea and I can't believe it didn't exist before. And I know Ryan's kind of a sketchy guy, but hey, I married Jim. I've done my part for the nice guy. Now I want a bedroom set.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think an investor's ski trip is the best idea. It will be a bonding experience.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was looking at a trail map, and I was thinking that we should start on a bunny hill, because I've never actually been skiing. And then work our way up to death drop.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Great, so we got our first offer to buy the company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your kidding?!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We could sell, but why think so small? We can just get a couple more people involved, really do this thing our way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You and me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: New Investors are key, though. That's actually why I came in today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't you work here full-time?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [chuckles] Today, I was thinking I would sit down with a few of the people who haven't invested yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Or we could do that together, if that sounds fun to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That does sound fun to me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [out in the parking lot with a guy unloading hay bales while Dwight sifts through the hay] Ah, this is good hay. Yeah. This is the good stuff, mattress quality.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Every fall, my Uncle Eldred used to build us a maze out of hay bales for us kids to play in. We called it "Hay Place". Eldred Called it "Hay World". Eventually lawyers were brought in. But that's all behind us. Hay Place lives on! [guy comes and sticks a Bale of Hay right behing Dwight and knocks it into Dwight] Watch it, watch it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello! Welcome to Hay Place! A place for hay.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Don't forget to make a broom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, and the Petting Zoo closes at 2:00, and the Goat Roast is at 3:00. Come on in, enjoy!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey, I'm kind of in the mood for a roll in the hay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Roll in the hay, five dollars.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I meant... [motions you and me]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, our contract.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, why don't we meet at the usual spot. [looks at his watch] Uh... I've got a half an hour during lunch in-between the historical reenactment of the dunmore farm slaughters and the onion boil.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Perfect!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, uh... [notices a kid walking on a bale of hay] Excuse me, get off of there! Those are show bales, not play bales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] All right, Thank you, I will-I will send the contracts over right away. All Right. [hangs up the phone and rubs his eyes] Whoo! [Erin jumps in the background]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am on the first hot sale streak of my life. I think it all comes from feeding Cece, because no matter how much she resists, I sell her those carrots. Let's be honest-if I can make mushed carrots seem better than a boob... I can pretty much sell anything. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Commission comes out to... dunh-duh-na-dah! Zero.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-Kay, Well, it can't be zero, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I entered the sale, and I hit enter, and I said, "dunh-duh-na-dah!" I'm pretty sure I timesed it right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You met your commission cap last week. So from here until the end of the fiscal year, your commission will be zero.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about? We-we have a commission cap?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's a new corporate policy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dunh-duh-na-dah!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Is this job really about the money for you, Jim? I mean, isn't this where you fell in love?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A commission cap takes away my incentive to sell. So you realize I now have no reason to work, right?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: When you're dealing with a large organization, sometimes you have to put up with policies you don't like. I wish my gym didn't allow full nudity in the locker room. Okay, seeing these old guys walking around naked feels almost passive-aggressive. But I deal with it. 'Cause it's policy. See what I mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Nudity makes me uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: My gym allows it. I wish they didn't, but it's policy. So I respect it, and I just-[put's his hands cupped by his face and turns away] keep a low-you know, I look away. Think about your commission cap as a naked old man in a gym locker room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone... SEX! Now that I have your attention...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You don't have our attention.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: MONEY!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm listening.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You had me at "Sex."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pervert.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You have all of our attention just by screaming anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's good to know. [screams]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you want to say, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wuphf! All right, I've warmed them up for you. You have the floor, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How's everybody doing?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good! Now, a lot of you have already staked out your corner of the WUPHF empire. Raise your hand if I'm describing you. [Michael, Pam, Daryl, and Stanley raise their hands]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yes, I have a dream. And It's not some M.L.K. Dream for Equality. I want to own a decommissioned Lighthouse. And I want to live at the top. And nobody knows I live there. And there's a button that I can press, and it'll launch that lighthouse into space.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: For my current investors, things are going great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We already have a buyer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?! Who?!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Washington University. I don't even want to think about selling until our numbers get into the billions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: At least.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So I've decided to open up a second round of investment to friends and family.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, God. Hold on to your wallets, ladies.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Did you ever think of WUPHF as an emergency notification system, like, for college campuses with shooters or gas leaks?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, no-Oscar, it's not-it's not a digital rape whistle. WUPHF is about fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Fun, communication, connection.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's your money situation?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, it's tight, as with any start-up.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sure, how long can you sustain this without a cash infusion?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We have nine solid days. I love these questions. Keep 'em coming.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm sorry, nine days until what?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Bankruptcy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, Ryan, so this could be over by the weekend?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How long do you think a week is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not this weekend; next weekend. We were gonna go on the investors ski trip. I bought poles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, since I have no incentive to sell, I've cleaned my car, organized my desk, and taken a multivitamin. So... what now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam. Okay, now I've tried everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you prank Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you like that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, it's not as fun if I'm not blowing off work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love you, but I'm kinda busy. So I need you to figure this one out on your own.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [blows a raspberry, Erin looks shocked, Kevin chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar said WUPHF only has enough money for nine days.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [colorful poster with numbers] Check this out.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: All that color.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at that. Triple your investment by January.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anyone can just throw numbes up on a chart. What are you doing to make it happen?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, earlier today, I was emailing someone by the name of John Legend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You have his email?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: A lot of these guys are just Mac.com, @ their website, whatever. We get that guy WUPHFing, it's all over.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I want my money back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do not talk like that, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ryan, just tell us your plan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, all right. I know what you wanna see. I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [hits the back of a Dunder-Mifflin Delivery Truck with his hand] Hey kids, was that fun?

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All Right!

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: I wanna go on it again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I bet you do. You know what? When I was a little kid, they couldn't get me off the hayride! But it's gonna cost you three more bucks. [kid gives him three more bucks]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow! This brings back memories. Hay stacking, hay throwing... and at the end of it all, one lucky boy would be crowned Hay King. I always wanted to be Hay King. The world shines on Mose.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [waiting for Dwight at their meeting place, slams the door shut]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Where have you been?! I've been waiting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, can we move this to the end of the day?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I-I think you should make time for it.

quotes.speaker: Little Girl
quotes.text: I found the needle in the haystack!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, congratulations! Do you know what your prize is?

quotes.speaker: Little Girl
quotes.text: I don't know!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing. Life Lesson? Some tasks are not worth doing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: WUPHF T-Shirts. Who wants one? Just imagine that you're at spring break, Daytona Beach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Everyone's like, "Hey Dude, whats up with all the hotties in the WUPHF shirts?" Or, Uh, "Hey, what's up with that helicopter? It's Ry from WUPHF!"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "It's Ryan the WUPHF guy!"

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "Yo, Ry from WUPHF!"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "He's up there."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: "What's he dropping?! Wow, what's falling on us, man?!" WUPHF condoms! 50,000 condoms out of the sky!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at that! He threw 'em on the ground!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, this is a marketing campgain. You got nine days. Let's say you do get the money. What are you going to do with it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The first lesson of Silicon Valley, actually, is that you only think about the user, the experience. You actually don't think about the money. Ever.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That sounds weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's not weird, Andy, and you know what else? We have an offer from Washington University. So monetize that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [walks in] Are you guys meeting about WUPHF? You know that that was my idea, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I said to Ryan, "I try to call you, and you don't have your phone. I try to I.M. You, and you're not online. I wish there was a way that I could do everything all at once, and I could just be like this little dog going, 'Ruff! Ruff! Ruff! Ruff! Ruff!'"

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Baby, Baby, Baby-

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I think I'm gonna stay here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I do, I do. This isn't right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I help you with your things and you help me with my things.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But I-it's not right.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [whispering] I got this, it's okay. Don't worry about this.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Is it any particular branch of Washington University?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The Washington University Public Health Fund.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: W.U.P.H.F.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: They only want it for the initials.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The domain name. Yeah, they do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I move we sell!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, sell!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, sell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sell.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Get us out of this!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Have some faith in this idea!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If everybody wants to sell, we sell, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I won't sell. And you know what? Ryan and I have the majority of shares. Isn't that right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes. You alone do, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I-yes. We're not selling. I will not sell.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [runs to and inside the Hay Place maze] Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Do you mind if we share this bale?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: There's no charge to sit on the hay, is there?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Probably.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: I mean, wouldn't you think the ten dollars to build your own broom would include the hay and not just the instructions?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: I mean, I'm starting to think this guy is just trying to make money off the holiday.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, instead of Hay Place, it should be pay place. [man laughs] Don't laugh at me.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: No, no, no, I wasn't-I was just laughing at your joke.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Pay Place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm. Yeah, so we can celebrate Thanksgiving-Me-Your-Money Day. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: That's humorous.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank You.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [stuck in the maze, says to some kids running around in the maze] You guys know how to get out? [kids run away screaming]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can't talk, saving the planet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, we don't recycle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We Don't? Well, why have I been separating the trash into whites and colors?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sure no one asked you to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [throws the sack of garbage onto the floor] Eight Years.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Listen, I know you really like Ryan-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I won't even consider it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I... [sits down] I hate to say this, but... you know this special bond that you've always felt with Ryan, where, like, you're best friends or you're his mentor or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, Yes, yeah. Best friend/mentor.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I think that feeling only goes one way. And I think that Ryan knows that, and he's taking advantage of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you are wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And there are a lot of other people in this office who have money at stake. Other people you care about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You may be right. I may be crazy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just saying that I think I agree with your point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but in a jokey way where you're gonna start singing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I thought it might make me feel better.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Go Ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] But it just may be a lunatic... [stops singing] No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hovering over Meredith's desk] Oh, nice, wasting time, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, back off. It's Solitare.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, kid-hear you're looking for work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: How far can you reach those Lovely long arms of yours? [Jim reaching his arms out as far as he can go] Eh, put 'em down. How long can you hold that pretty little breath of yours? [Jim inhales] Good.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Hey, Jim? Are you distracting these people?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: We're working. [Jim still holding his breath]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Can you at least try to look busy? [Jim Exhales]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [listening to and editing Jo's book on tape]

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: "The moment Darla put the cupcake in her mouth, her daddy pulled her aside and said, "You're Too Fat. No one's gonna like you if you're too fat." The next time I saw David Geffen was at the buffalo club. "I love you, you Gay Bastard," I said. "You Gay Bastard," I s-. "Gay Ba-" "Gay B-""

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, how's it going, bro?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, good, bro.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, thanks so much for having my back out there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Always have your back. So, any ideas on how we can get over this nine-day hump here?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I have nothing but ideas. The thing is, they all require money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nine days, though. That's, like...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, I know I've tapped you so hard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, you have tapped this. Hard.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh, you are funny, Michael. You-people, people don't give you enough credit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe I could take a second mortgage on my condo.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, a lot of people are doing that. And there don't seem to be any consequences. And they say the rates have never been lower.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you would think that's a good idea for me to do?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Think about this. You and me on a private plane flown by our private pilot-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Eating our private meal cooked by our private chef.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, we never even have dinner now, so...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We totally should.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I gotta work on this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh right. What am I saying? Rain Check.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. [Michael closes the door]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And now, by show of applause, We will crown this year's hay king. All in favor of Purebred. [crowd applauds] Put your hands together for... Mixed Bread. [crowd applauds] And let's hear it for... Purebred. [crowd applauds] Mm. It appears we have a three-way tie. I have no choice but to pick the Hay King myself. I pick... [all three contestants begging for Dwight to pick them] Me! I am your Hay King! All Hail your Hay King! [drowd leaves disgusted, as Dwight's worker claps]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did I truck 300 bales of hay to a parking lot to rectify some childhood disappointment? Yes.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: So, if I were to call Dunder Mifflin and ask for Miss Angela Martin, would I get through to you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You would. And if I were to call your house and ask for your wife, would I get through to you?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: My wife passed away a few years ago.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How tragic. Very sorry to hear that.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Thank You.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [still stuck in maze] Help! Hello?! Oh! Help![runs around the maze]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [opens the door the Ryan's office, grabs him by the shirt, pulls him out of his chair] Consider it a WUPHF in person. [shoves Ryan down to a chair]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Your doing the wrong thing. You're gonna lose Michael's investment. You're gonna lose ours.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You got this crazy opportunity to get our money back. Tell Mike To Sell.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If you tell Michael to sell, he'll sell.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm betting on myself.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's a bad bet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey. It's an ambush here. Nobody here believes in this company. Will you tell them they're wrong?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not that we don't believe in the company, We don't believe in you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All those in favor of selling, say aye. [all say "aye"]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I. Do not agree to sell, which is to say nay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? What happened to you in High School?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, are you that blind?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not blind! I know exactly who he is. He is selfish and lazy and image-obsessed, and he is a bad friend. [all seem to be in agreenment] And he's also clever. And he shoots incredibly high. And he may just make it. But you know what? Even if he doesn't, I would rather go broke betting on my people, than get rich all by myself, on some island like a castaway. And there is no middle ground.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're gonna lose all of our money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Only if he fails. And you know what? Ryan, I believe in you. Just like I believe in all of you. You have nine days to save everybody's money.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh... Uh, That's a lot of pressure. I-I'm gonna need some more time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can't have it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay. I won't let you down. [Ryan goes back into his office and shuts the door]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela? [slides open the door] Angela! [see's a note on the door, reads it, and then crumples it up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The world sends people your way... Ryan came to me through a temp agency. Andy was transferred here. No idea where Creed came from. The point is you just have to play with the cards that you're dealt. [camera pans to different people in the office] Jim, that guy is an ace. Dwight is my King up my sleeve. Phyllis is my old maid. Oscar is my queen. That's easy. Gimme a hard one. That's what Oscar said. Toby is the instruction card you throw away. Pam's a solid seven. And yeah, you know what? Ryan is probably, like, a two. But sometimes twos can be wild. So watch out. And I am obviously the joker. So... [phone rings, computer chimes, etc.] That's Uh...

quotes.speaker: Robotic Voice
quotes.text: WUPHF, from Ryan Howard. Decided to sell company. Thanks, bro. Hell of a ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [puts his phone in his coffee mug and calls Gabe]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Gabe Lewis.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [Jim's edited version of her book on tape]:
